entries.player_sorry_2: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_reset_2: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.npc_reset_2: A shame you couldn't finish what you started. Best of luck in your future endeavors.
entries.waypoint_description_2: Find the man with the prototype and kill him.  Bring the prototype back to Zhord.
entries.waypoint_description_1: Get the briefcase from the CSA officer.
entries.return_waypoint_description_2: Report your success back to Jusani Zhord.
entries.return_waypoint_description_1: Bring the briefcase back to Jusani Zhord.
entries.player_sorry_1: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_reset_1: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_5_1: How come you're a civilian now?
entries.player_3_1: What would I need to do?
entries.npc_work_2: Did you get the prototype? I won't allow anyone else to get rich off that design.
entries.npc_work_1: Where is my briefcase? I hope I haven't made a mistake by employing you.
entries.npc_reward_2: Job well done. I admire your professionalism. When the time comes for me to execute my plans of revenge on my remaining enemies, I shall keep you in mind.
entries.npc_reward_1: Well done. Please treat yourself to something nice. Talus offers many pleasures to the discriminating buyer.
entries.npc_reset_1: A shame you couldn't finish what you started. Best of luck in your future endeavors.
entries.npc_noloc_2: Allow me to verify the man's coordinates. Check back with me in a few moments.
entries.npc_noloc_1: Allow me a few moments to verify those coordinates.
entries.npc_more_1_1: What? He's still alive? But we killed him! I saw his ship blasted to pieces! We killed him!
entries.npc_failure_2: This is an unfortunate setback but nothing that a belt of thermal detonators couldn't remedy. That will create more of a stir on Talus than I had initially wanted, but a man must do what he must do.
entries.npc_failure_1: How tragic that you were unable to assist my plans. I believe I shall have to be more discriminating in the future.
entries.npc_breech_1: Look lively, gentlemen! I don't like the look of that one!
entries.npc_backtowork_2: No more delays. Please attend to your duties.
entries.npc_backtowork_1: But really, enough talk. Now is the time for action. Do you wish to reconsider?
entries.npc_6_1: The specifics of my downfall are not important. What is important is that those who betrayed me are about to get rich at my expense and I will do everything in my power to stop them. Do you wish to help me or not?
entries.npc_5_1: Not anymore.  Because I helped organize and fund the research team that led to the discovery of this new ion engine. I had to bend some rules here and there, of course, and that's exactly what my enemies used to discredit me. So it would be a cold day on Tatooine before I let them get rich off my sacrifice.
entries.npc_4_1: A Corporate Sector Authority executive, a former

of mine, will be transporting some schematics for an experimental ion engine to his superiors. I want those schematics. They're locked safely in a briefcase so you should have no trouble finding them. Do what you will with the CSA officer, although I tend to think he'll fight to the death to protect that briefcase.
entries.npc_3_2: As you wish. My credits will simply go to another.
entries.npc_3_1: Not a terribly ambitious sort, eh? So be it. There are plenty of others who are.
entries.npc_2_2: Excellent. You'll find the man with the prototype at this location.  I want it brought back to me.
entries.npc_2_1: Ah, how well I recognize unbridled ambition. If you never temper justice with mercy, you'll go far. Oh, be sure to tell my former business associate that Moff Zhord sends his regards.
entries.npc_1_2: The second phase of my plan must now go into effect. Having secured the only known plans for the experimental ion engine, I must now call upon your services to remove the only existing prototype. If you thought I was generous before, then you should probably undertake this mission. You in?
entries.npc_1_1: Enjoying your stay on Talus? I find it quite relaxing here. Of course I'm looking at it from a civilian's perspective now. Used to be my word was law in this sector and the fates of billions of sentient beings were held in my hand. But that was a long time ago, when I was young and idealistic. So idealistic in fact that I chose to ignore my enemies, thinking they couldn't possibly hurt someone in my position. But I won't ignore them now. Care to make some money helping a former Moff correct the mistakes of his past?
entries.notyet: I don't have anything for you at the moment.
entries.notit_1: That is not the briefcase I asked you to bring me. I do hope you're not trying to cheat me.
entries.next: That is all I require of you at the moment. I shall have to carefully plot my revenge against my remaining enemies. Check back with me from time to time.
entries.cant_work: I won't tempt you with assignments while you are currently employed by another. Seek me out when you're free.
